review: This is my second visit to this place (#2683) and all the times our server Christi did really good job. She one of the waitresses who can show an example to another one how to work with guests. Special thank you to Christi and of course to the kitchen who make perfect steak and ribs, burgers for us. Will be back for sure.

What can I say about this place that most people don't already know. Its a chain restaurant that serves all the common American foods. My server was pretty good, my steak was good even cooked it to a perfect medium. But the "crispy" Brussels sprouts were anything but crispy. It was more like a soggy mini cabbage drowning in oil and vinegar. All in all had a good meal but did seems a bit pricey for a chain restaurant my bill came out to $63 with one drink each and an app. Not including the $13 tip. Should've just cooked a steak at home. But at least I didn't have to clean up after myself.

I was sent for 3 days of training with work and decided to stop here for dinner. My coworker and I spent 2 hours here eating, drinking and talking. We ordered drinks, appetizers and food. We sat in the bar area, our server was awesome and split our checks just like we asked. Food was very good, drinks were on point. I haven't been to a Friday's in a while but this trip was perfect! If I come back to Rosemont in the future, I would come back here without any doubt!!

My boss chose "TGI Fridays" because she loves this chain.  Me?  It wouldn't be on top of my list.  Once again, "never say never" is my motto.  I was still "somewhat" looking forward to dining at their Rosemont location.   We were estimating between 6 to 8 people to show up for my store manager's "pre-maternity leave" dinner.  Whoever organized this event should have made the reservation for party this size.  Nevertheless, the hostess or the manager-on-duty accommodated our request within a short 10-minute wait.   Jessica, our server, provided good service, but she also took care a few other tables in proximity and at times we had to remind her for the items we needed, drink refills, round 2/3 endless appetizer orders (a number of associates opted for this option), and ultimately, the checks.   Splitting checks wasn't a problem.  Overall, I was quite impressed by Jessica's performance.  One of the "secondary" server was a bit rough on delivering the appetizers and the "to-go" cheesecake order.  We all knew her actions weren't ill-intentioned.   Well, the lackluster food I consumed this evening did some significantly damages on the rating of my review.  My "steak & ribs" entree wasn't, at all, memorable.  Although the steak was done how I wanted (medium in this case), it lacked flavor.  In addition, nothing was robust about these ribs.  They were also a bit sweet for my taste.   This might be the last time I walked into a TGI Fridays, unless my boss has another baby or has an explainable craving for some of her favorite finger foods (crispy fried green beans, buffalo wings, and fried pickles).

Horrible. We sat in the bar and had the bartender as our server, he was clearly overwhelmed (despite it not being busy.) our food took extremely long for just two appetizers and then came out cold. Manager Courtney was super nice and offered to replace but we just wanted to leave. Bartender couldn't even be bothered to refill my water or check on us. Friday's food prices just keep climbing and the quality just keeps slipping, combine that with poor service and it's just not worth it.

Had dinner here with my cousin and her kiddos.  We both got the Mahi Mahi on a wood plate with wilted greens and a tomato mozzarella salad. It was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. The mozz was cheap and old but it's ok -- I can't expect perfection from TGI Fridays right? The things that bothered me: our waitress was either new or the manager was. She was chicken hawking this poor server so much that our server had to check on us FIVE times. Five. (?? What manager has her servers bug their customers??) The other -1 star was for the mac n cheese. It was velveeta or a similar cheese; only it was watered down and the noodles were far overdone. My niece who Hoovers all food was hesitant to eat it and we ended up sharing our plates with her. They did remove it from the bill, so I was very grateful they did that.  I tipped our poor waitress well, but I fear she might leave for lack of a good manager!

Food mediocre, service horrible. Waitstaff more interested in standing around the kitchen area than doing their job. Tables unattended and needing clearing , should have been our que to turn around and try another place for a   late night meal.

Checked on line for the Rib Take Out Special and it came up was still in promotion.  Drove over 20 minutes in rush hour traffic -- and the person who met me said they no longer had the special -- I questioned her and she got her manager who basically came out and said -- there is no special on line or anywhere else advertised -- so I asked "then you are calling me a liar" and he continue to pretty much do so!  Wow -- no wonder these places are being closed down!

Sat in the bar. Slow service. Ordered a vodka tonic and my friends got tap beer which was $4. Linda ordered the Sam Adams nitro coffee stout which was good but not on special. Kim Crawford was 13 dollars per glass which is what a bottle costs.  My friends ordered the sliders and flatbread for appetizers. They liked them and would order again. Service was painfully slow. Waitress needs a smaller section.  Will come back only because it is close to work.
Freezing cold in there couldn't even enjoy my dinner. Complained to the manager and didn't do no good said was on a timer really ?!?!?  Never again.
Terry the bartender sucks and is in everyone's business.  Won't go when he's there.  Don't know what his problem is.

Waited in the bar for 15 minutes before, the waiter even said he would be with us... He came back and asked did we know what we wanted, you never gave us menus. Then he said he will be back with water and menus that was another 10 minutes. No apologies or nothing. If you can't handle the crowd don't be a waiter. Terrible service

Had lunch with a friend. The food was great. We ordered the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken pasta, which was great,  and the Ribeye with mash potatoes and fries, this was also really good. The atmosphere was good as well; calm I mean. Our waitress on the other had gave us a little attitude. I'm guessing because we weren't ready to order when she came back from bringing us our drinks 10 minutes later from when she asked. My guess is she was probably new. Other than that it was a good time being there. I'm sure I'll be going back.

I'm sorry , but nothing about this experience was good . Although the server was nice , the food was terrible . Not to mention they got the order wrong . This was like the third chance we've given this restaurant. I'm done !
always good service and good food!  love this out of the way location in Rosemont!
Just got a comment on my Yelp from most likely an employee there that say "fuk q" and "mike says hi".  Classy. The service still sucks there obviously.

I have had a few bad experiences at this location but decided to give it a try.  Not good at all.  Whenever I am here I always feel like I am being rushed through my meal.  Working down the street it is a convenient place for me to go with a coworker or agent I have in town.  The menu has something for everyone and lots of choices.  Unfortunately most are bad.   My guest orders a half slab of ribs and got 4 very small ribs.  I'm sure that's a quarter slab.  Got an attitude when we questioned server politely.   My burger was way over cooked.  Asked for medium.  I hate to complain when I go out but I was very unhappy at how long our meal took and the fact they got it wrong and the fact they were rude about it. Lots of other options in area, will not be going back.

Great service and the food came out fast.   I customized a burger and they let me swap out the regular beef patty for a vegetarian style black bean burger with fries.   All very yummy. My fiancé ordered the nightly special which was a steak and lobster deal for $14.99.   Very good price and he got a lot of food.   Would highly recommend if you're trying to kill some time waiting on a flight, stop here for some good food.  It's not far from O'Hare airport.

Highly recommend! If you have the chance to get here, Terry the bartender makes a killer mojito! Hands down he is great at what he does- very attentive to customer needs. If Im ever back in the area I'll be back

Tried to get a takeout on the rib dinner special.  The tv ad and online menu both said you could take out at that price.  When I called in to order I was told the manager said to get the special price you have to dine in.  I mentioned that both the tv and online menu said the price was good for take out.  He stated to me that he knew that but the manager said no.  My wife wasn't feeling well that is why we chose takeout, but upon hearing this she said let's go.  We did, the ribs were good and our server (Nick) was great.  We approached the manager (Amy) and asked about the problem.  She stated that corporate told her it was for dine in only.  I told her that the tv and her own online menu both said takeout or dine in.  After alot of double talk she said from now on she would allow takeout.  I think it was alot of BS.  I don't  think she would be willing to go against corporate if in fact they said no takeout.  My wife didn't feel well but she was determined to confront the manager.

The food itself was good. The visit was plagued with no, "we can't" or "we'll try".  To list merely one of these, waitress asked, Pink or no pink for my burger, I said medium- a little pink.  Waitress response was "not sure we can do that" and sure enough, my burger arrived pink, pink.  Even my dining companion who is so forgiving working in the restaurant business was surprised with all the nos we received.  She had chicken and rice and said it was good.  The cherry limeade was delicious and upon ordering you are told no free refills for that particular drink which was o-k by me.   It was good enough that I will go back and try something else on the menu. Given the competitive environment, I am surprised they are able to get away with so many "no,-we can'ts" on substitutions. Mashed were good too-served with fresh chives, no gravy.

This one star is  for a new manager and his new reuls,  a lot of times I visited this place for many years because the food was okey and menu god and nice atmosphere. However, a week ago I was denied in bar seal alcohol because I did not have illinois ID, I have only a passport , the answer was we not accxept passport any more . I think many tourists will not be satisfied with the impossibility of drinking alcohol .... Huge disappointment. good luck TGI ...

Obviously wasn't expecting much because it's a Friday's but this Friday's is exceptionally shitty. Piss poor service. Server stopped by four times but forgot our silverware, forgot to bring napkins, forgot to refill water, and forgot our check.

Came here for lunch, and quite frankly, I was still full from breakfast, but, when the "gang" is ready to go, you go.  Tried a couple of Appetizers on the $5.00 menu.  Had the Sesame Jack Chicken strips and the sirloin Hibachi Skewers.  Both were great, but the Sirloin skewers were a bit on the Med well side and a bit chewy.  The service was quick, and everyone at our table enjoyed their food. Stay hungry my friends...
Great service by Nina! Maybe the kindest waitress I've ever had! Food was fast and tasty.  A nice lunch stop on this work trip.
Worst service ever! I just got a soup and it took almost 2hrs to process my check. Lady just walked around with my card and never did anything with it. I love TGIF just not this one.

Seems like kids run this place. The one at the door said they'd have to split my group up. I asked again because it seemed ridiculous, but she and another kid that shows up shortly after we walked in confirmed it was two separate tables or nada. So we opted for nada. I was so disappointed I didn't even bother speaking to a manager. My wife called chillis, made reservations and a table for 12 was waiting for us when we arrived. I'll make it a point to avoid this place going forward.

Food has been good both times I have came to this location no complaints, I have had better customer service though when busier than when slow not sure why but I am patient as long as the food is good I will not hold it against them.

Ok this has been a long time coming. So my wife and I decided to stop in before hitting Ohare airport. We walked in and the greeter pretty much yelled from across the way and let us know to park ourselves anywhere, so we did. I didn't have an issue with that at all. So we sit and it took about 15 minutes before someone came by with a menu and also to greet us. Again I'm thinking to myself it has to be busy and I give them the benefit of the doubt. Now after about 10 minutes the person comes back and takes our drink order. Alright this is were I drew the line. We waited 15 minutes for drinks that we never got. Someone else came by and asked if we were being helped and they had no idea someone took an order from us. Ok we were in there for an easy 45 min with nothing at all on our table. We got the menus and that was it. I have made it a promise to myself not to judge all TGIF restaurants on this experience. It was one of the worst I have had and I make sure to go out of my way to tell others not to go. Thanks for a waste of time guys.

We waited a while to be seated here on a Friday night. No big deal, as we arrived during the crazy dinner rush. TGI Friday's usually has something for all tastes, but I found myself resorting to an appetizer as my main dish because they don't offer a lot of meatless options. The pretzel sticks with beer cheese were delicious and I snagged half of my husband's mashed potatoes. Everyone at my table seemed to enjoy their food: steaks and pasta. Service was good. 3/5 because the restaurant is too dark, food is mediocre chain- restaurant food and I was limited as far as entrees were concerned.

Scanning reviews it seems most are reporting on the overall service.   TGI is a local option for me to grab something or join a work lunch with the office.  Thinking back about an experience where we sat and dined in, we were seated next to the kitchen and yet still there were times we were looking for the waiter.  I'm not sure where he went but when he returned he always looked hurried.  I think they (waitstaff) follow a step by step for dealing with seated customers.  While we had the look of "We have to go now!" across our faces, he still asked if we wanted to order coffee or desserts.  The move was so strange, which makes me think they have to ask.   Other than that, food is almost always good and never a problem.   It's as good as chain food can be.  I am a bit particular to the Jack Daniel's line of sandwiches and entrees.  MMmm, sweet sauce for dipping, you just can't go wrong.  This is a newer location with its own lot but shared with a tall office building next door.  Weekday lunches can be very busy, so plan accordingly or call ahead.

My husband and I often end up here after his late shift ends.  Service is prompt, friendly, and they will often let you double up on coupons or will sneak you an extra side. The food is pretty much the standard TGIF fare, but it's good. Try the mozzarella sticks; they are the best!

I came to grab lunch w a friend before I went to work. We got the mozzarella sticks and spin dip. The food was nothing special but wasn't bad. They have a pretty good happy hour too for drinks and apps. I got a strawberry margarita and it was way too sweet. The server didn't have too many tables and joked around w us which was a plus. All in all it was alright.

Horrible, horrible, horrible. DON'T COME HERE!! Right off the bat we ordered our drinks half the people at the table got their drinks the other half waited another 10 minutes during their slow period. We waited for an hour and a half for our food. I ordered a side salad she forgot the dressing twice. My friends steak came out wrong twice, waitress pretty much ran away after the second time and my other friends order was messed up. Our alcoholic beverages were made wrong. Waitress was extremely out of it. A quick bite to eat turned into 2 hours. Not to mention we had to split our own checks. She couldn't even do that.

I'm surprised by the negative reviews on here. I was at this Friday's last Sunday after the Chicago Sky game. I had such good service and my waitress always checked on us and our dishes and drinks were pretty good. I'll be back once I'm in the area.

Been there two times now and I loved it! Used to go to Chili's in Rosemont but two experiences with bad service, bad food and incredibly dirty restroom. Greeters are friendly and attentive. Restaurant is clean and love the modern update. The bar is wonderful, lots of seating and lots of televisions. Drinks were fantastic (had the Long Island Tea) and the food was very good. Had the reuben first time and skewered chicken and rice the second time and very delicious and cooked to perfection. Would go back again.  If you think it's just another run of the mill TGI Friday's...think again!!

Really nice decor but here's my issue. There are 5 servers standing at the door. There are about 8 tables of guests in the bar. The bartender is waiting on all of the tables and the people at the bar and not one person is helping him. I have seen the manager he's wandering around not helping. Service is so slow. Can't understand it. Bartender should stay behind the bar and servers should come over and serve. The bartender is now sitting at the bar chatting with a patron. Sitting on the opposite side of the bar and the manager is standing watching football. You cannot make this stuff up. Just save your time and do not come here!

I work in the area, so just about any time there is a work lunch, or just need to get away for an hour, this is my spot.  Because all TGI Friday menus are the same, if you like their food at any location, you'll like their food here. This location is kept pretty clean, so unless you're here at peak weekend hours or during a game (this is a location that pulls in a good crowd for sporting events) cleanliness should not be an issue.  Lunch crowd, please be kind and remember that this restaurant is close to O'hare international airport, shopping centers, a casino, as well as many local businesses. It can get very busy and very loud at times. It is always hit or miss with the speed of things. Some days it is just slow, and that's that. Other days everything is moving like a well oiled machine.

To start off, I think they serve RC Cola... My diet "coke" was flat :( No problem, changed to iced-tea :) But then our server took our order without writing things down (I worry when there are requests). My friend asked for no onions in his burger. Pretty simple request, but nope, not granted. Jason, our server, was so uninterested that he never brought any table settings, no napkins, no silverware, no condiments (simple ketchup for fries, ya know?). I had to get up from our table and go to the server station to help myself with the silverware and napkins. Later I had to get up again to ask the bartender for ketchup. Wish we would've sat at the bar, the bartender was way more personable than Jason, who just seemed like he did not want to be there.   If you come to this Fridays and get greeted by a Jason with glasses, ask to sit at the bar please, just doing you a favor so you can enjoy your meal better ;)

I had a great experience at TGIF.  Michael was our server and he did a great job being patient with me.  I wasn't sure what to eat since I am a vegetarian and he made several suggestions.  He was very nice and friendly.  Very upbeat and whenever he visited our table it felt like we were talking to an old friend.   Will definitely be back soon.  Those breadsticks are amazing - order them with a side of JD glaze as an appetizer, you won't regret it!!

The food and service is plain bad, seriously terrible! Came here one afternoon for a quick bite to eat, and sat at the bar. The bartender was definitely not happy to be there and gave us major attitude for nothing. We got an appetizer to share and a drink. It took forever to get our food, and then she over charged us for it.  The food tasted nasty, worst TGI location ever!

I'm sorry, I almost gave them a 2* until my steak came out twice wrong. I'm sorry, As I'm writing the review our waitress tried to give us someone else's food. I'm sorry, Idk how to organize how terrible my experience was, but my friends drink wasn't made right twice. I'm sorry, The berries weren't muddled before they shook it on either drink so there wasn't any flavor from them. I'm sorry, The food tasted good, for being wrong. I'm sorry, then we had to split our own bill. I'm sorry, we didn't trust her to get it right. I'm sorry, she said sorry for every sentence.  If you couldn't tell I'm frustrated. I'm going to McDonald's.

Food was good. I really enjoyed the Jack Daniel's boneless chicken wings. The fried pickles were very interesting. Surprisingly,  I liked them. The environment was welcoming and clean.  Hopefully  my bf and I will be able to get there 1 more time before she moves away.

Worst service, food is awful. A black guy is a manager when i complaint he said well u ate half of it. This was his response to my complaint, do u want the check? You see!  Make story short i called the Corporate office, after pressing 10 options finally someone answered and she said someone will get back to you by Friday. :)

A local standard for us - maybe 10 minute drive with good discounts / coupons / loyalty program. We've been here many times, with mixed fair to excellent service, and always fair to decent food. If we have a problem, they are consistently responsive, though have had to escalate it to the manager before. This really should be handled at the server level! The four star rating is based upon the Fridays model and expectations, multiple experiences but biased strongly on our last visit is the one which prompted this review. Many chain restaurants have corporate set menus, and Fridays fits this model. The menu items are diverse and tasty when prepared correctly. We were welcomed and seated immediately. Our server (don't remember his name) was friendly and prompt, always sure we liked what we had and that our drinks were never empty. He offered suggestions, and was very accommodating with our requests. This visit, my wife ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken, and I created my own burger. The chicken was ordered with different sides, and everything came as she wanted. My burger was ordered medium rare, and I was told the chef can't make it less than medium. I asked him to make it as rare as he felt comfortable, and it came back the rare side of medium, juicy and full of flavor. The onions and mushrooms were very good, with a topping of chipotle mayo, lettuce and tomato were satisfying. The manager, Walter, came by and said hello. He remembered us from a previous visit when we had some trouble, and both times he was very apologetic and professional in his response. We feel comfortable coming to Friday's in Rosemont because the food is predictable and good, and should there be an issue, we know it will be handled - at least at some level. We also suggest the restaurant seating area for better service, as we have gone barely noticed in the bar when we don't order alcohol. One suggestion, and another 1/2 star off, is that the men's restroom, though not toxic, seems to always need some attention. Water all over the sinks and waste basket at or near overflowing.

Just don't come here during shift change at bar.  I would not leave a review like this, but this is the second time this has happened.   Basically ignored by outgoing bartender except grabbed my beer and said someone else would be taking care of me.   10-12 minutes later I watched new bartender count money. Walk around not saying anything.    Finally they switched and I went to the bathroom.  When I came back new girl yawned and asked if I needed a menu.  I said no I need to know how much this beer is.  She walked to register, walked back, put the check on the bar and Walked away.  I had originally walked in ready for some Ribs and to invite friends who were staying nearby.  But instead I left and went elsewhere.
Cant go wrong with half rack of ribs an rib eye steak i love coming to fridays food is always good jack Daniels flavoring is good

I had a $25 gift card so came by with my brother. We went all out and ordered a few things. The restaurant is nice and our waiter was super attentive.  The food was good, but not mind blowing or anything special.  Kind of expensive for simple dishes. We ordered: The sampler: the fried shrimp waa super yummy, ribs were very good and tender. The chicken nuggets/ w.e. they were was not good. Too much breading, I felt like I was eating toasted bread. The sauce it all came with wasn't good either.  Traditional chicken wings with buffalo sauce.  Good and meaty. Sauce needed more flavor and spice.  Chicken and shrimp pasta - my brother loved it. Sizzling chicken and shrimp with mashed potatoes. Very good and filling and flavorful. All in all good food, good atmosphere, attentive staff, a little pricy,but just what you would expect from this type of chain resturant.

So I had my ID stolen and was issued a temporary paper by the state of Illinois, because they mail them now apparently. Manager told me they can't accept the paper (or scan the bar code). Normally I'm pretty reasonable, but cmon. I get it, they are under no obligation to serve me, but that goes both ways :). Never going back. Thanks anyway guys.

Missing ingredients!!!Been going here for years, but there has been a lot of changes to the menu. They use to have the best potato skins, now there just okay. I ordered the chicken bruschetta tonight which I've had multiple times. They have sadly changed the noodles and added way to much tomato sauce. The worst part was they did not put any balsamic vinegar and garlic flakes on my dinner. It looks like they must have just forgot to put the ingredients on because I looked at the menu and even though they changed the noodles it was still suppose to have balsamic vinegar and garlic flakes. Very disappointed I hope with all the new restaurants going up in rosemont TGi Fridays steps up there game.

Excellent service, Christina, our server was a joy! Food was great and prepared to perfection. My son had a rack of ribs that was gone in 5 minutes! Meat just fell off the bone. Loved my sizzling chicken! Much needed dinner out, and well worth it!

Found this TGI Fridays on the way to the airport, and my husband and I were "wowed"! I had the $10 mahi- mahi lunch- with two sides- spinach and mac&cheese- FANTASTIC ! And here can you eat like this for $10 bucks? Beats any other restaurant and especially airport food. Our waitress was Vesna, sweet and efficient!

Very bad customer service. Know the type that rushes around looking super busy, but not making any eye contact with the customers? Also I saw 3 servers coming out of the kitchen to carry 3 plates (1 each). Was that efficient? We waited 10 minutes for someone to get pick up our bill and card, just watching them rush around before we can grab one.

I've been here a lot since I'm a stripes member and I buy discounted gift cards.  I know what to order and what not to order, I also come fairly early on the weekend.  Lately, the servers seem to be better trained and there are two who have served us for a long time who are very good. I have had problems and called over a manager (never had one just walk around asking how things are).  He was less than helpful both times, so I called the GM when he was in to talk about it.   I do think without the coupons and specials that Fridays is on the pricey side. $13.60 for the 8 oz. flatiron with two sides, none of which are a side salad like Longhorn or Outback.  No bread either. Close to $14 for the cajun chicken and shrimp pasta, again no unlimited salad or bread sticks like at Olive Garden.

I had gone into this establishment, the bartender was rude.    I had asked are you still open and she said I don't know what time it is, and she was all frustrated.  I was a bartender for many years and now a  manager of a restaurant..everyone is important no matter what time it is. I do not recommend this location they are a highly highly highly unorganized . Not my first bad experience  I'll  assume if I'm dumb enough not my last

I come here often. I find it's usually a hit or miss experience. Tonight I came with six friends for a causal dinner/hangout. The waitress was very friendly and took our order right away. Everyone in our party got unlimited appetizers, except one friend who got the Cajun chicken/shrimp pasta. The appetizers came out within a few minutes. Most of us ordered wings, which tasted fresh and had just the right amount of sauce. I tried some of the pasta which also tasted pretty good. The shrimp was particularly nice. Overall, it was a good experience. The only con for me was that the waitress did not refill my drink a second time (even though it was empty) until I asked toward the end of the meal. I would have given 5 stars if it weren't for this slight lack in service. She was otherwise quick, friendly and professional. Good food, pleasant atmosphere. For only $10 (endless apps), dining here is a sweet deal.

Had dinner here the other night and the service was great. The only thing was the waitress was a bit slow at first when it came to checking on our table, but that's probably because they seemed busy that night. Later she was more attentive to us. I ordered one of the burgers and the burger itself was good and the fries were delicious.

When I came to the establishment, I ordered the "Really Good Burger ."  When I got my food, there were pickles on the burger.  Secondly, the burger was not "Really Good," but tasted only adequate. I was so disappointed...

OMG!! Waited over an hour for our food on a slow time. Then on top of that our steak was cooked WRONG twice and my wife's order was messed up. DON'T COME HERE. Just bad if I could rate this at a 0 I would.

Getting 1 star because no star is not an option. Started off wrong from the get go.  Walked in and asked for a booth.... None available because there was no server for those sections.  A couple minutes later a family was seated at the booth we requested.   I ordered my favorite salad.  The chipotle chicken Yucatan salad. Was brought the wrong salad. Waitress explains she rung up the wrong salad and would put the correct one in.  After my family was done eating, my salad finally shows up.  Who wants to be the only one eating?! Well, the chicken was ice cold.  Sent it back.  Next salad, the chicken was burning hot, and the salad tasted awful.   It was one disappointment after another. Won't be coming back to this place. It's a shame too, since I've always loved TGIF..

This TGI was conveniently located near our hotel and the airport, so we have dined here on a couple of occasions.  When we were here last week what I appreciated is that they stay open late--kitchen and bar.  Although we arrived  back into town at 8:30 pm on a Sunday evening, many of the restaurants in the area were closing shop at 9 p.m.  Odd to me, considering that the very busy O'Hare airport is adjacent to this town and there's also a nearby concert arena.  So rather than risk receiving abrupt service or be rushed through our meal, we opted to dine at at TGIF which is open very late.  Prices are reasonable, and we were able to get a comfy booth and some tasty burgers and sandwiches that hit the spot!

So on New Year's Eve, the boyfriend and I were hungry so we saw this Friday's was near the hotel we were staying at so we said "Sure! Haven't been there in a while". So off we went. We arrive and were sat right away. Our server was prompt and very friendly as well so that's a plus! Wish I remembered her name. We ordered the 3 appetizers for $13 option and selected parmesan garlic boneless wings, potato skins, and pretzel breadsticks. The boyfriend ordered chicken tenders (I laughed at this lol) and I ordered the bourbon plank chicken I believe? With my choice of two sides I got the French Onion soup for an extra charge and tomato mozzarella salad.  Between the appetizer and my soup I was so full I only ate one bite of my chicken just to try it. I ended up putting it in a salad the next day and it was very good! So overall, everything was decent but you have to remember it's still Friday's so I'm gonna stick with the 3 stars. I will be back but probably not again until I say, "Sure! Haven't been there in a while" And off I will go.

Ask for Karen in the bar!!! She is by far the best bar server we've ever had at TGIFridays. The last time we went in our server was not so friendly, you know the judge a book by its cover type. Being in the industry, we know how some people are. It just so happened, Karen brought out our appetizer and I immediately asked for her name. Tonight we didn't forget to ask to sit with her. She's a pleasure! She's attentive, polite, and just overall a great server. Karen made our experience enjoyable unlike the last time. Keep her around and we'll definitely keep coming back. Thanks Karen!!   P.S. Don't forget to tip your server!!

The food is what you would expect from any TGI Friday's, ok but not spectacular. I'm disappointed with the service we got. We went on a Sunday night, so there wasn't a lot of people dining there. After entering the restaurant, we waited at the front for quite sometime just for someone to acknowledge and seat us. When we were seated, it took the waitress a little while to greet us as well (again, the place was not busy at all). Once our waitress brought our food out to us, she tended to other customers that were starting to walk in. Our empty glasses sat on our table for a while, while she walked right past us to talk to another customer. I basically had to flag her down to get a refill on my water.  Overall, dining here made me remember why I stopped eating at this restaurant chain in the first place. The food isn't great and the service is on the crappy side, so we will be avoiding this place from here on out.

Went here thinking they still had the half price apps and they dont  the food here Is pretty good, never have had bad service BUT i dont think they give you enough food esp for a grown man. My husband had the sizzling chicken and left hungry. I would def go back for dinner with my girlfriends but not my first choice by far. I would rather get more food for my dollar and be able to bring home what i dont finish

Worst service I've ever had. We had to get up and find our server to pay our bill. The manager walked by and didn't bother to ask how we were doing. The place is a joke and I would never go back. This dish is also prepared horribly. Steak was dry and NOT what I requested which was medium well. And why the hell don't they have a Friday special on booze if it's called TGI FRIDAYS.
Everything you come to expect from a TGI Fridays.

Typical dirty Friday's. Sticky floor, un-bussed tables and trash on floor.  How amazing, we still go back.  Disgusting.....but $4 beer is Hard to pass up. Surprised that the chicken club I had was good.  Portions are small but I don't need to eat any more.  Bartenders not very friendly. Too busy I guess.
This is your typical Friday's. Only reviewing because the couple times I was here, we sat in the bar area and the service was awesome. Servers and bartenders were always friendly! Enjoy!
Bar tender/ Waiter   not much customer service. But drink was good! Disappointed on what TGIF considers ULTIMATE NACHOS!?

This is the 5th TGI Fridays location that I have reviewed.  This one fared very well for us for a Saturday lunch.  The greeter was sincerely welcoming to us, as was our server.   The food was a little bit slow coming out but that just may have been my perception because I was so hungry.  The food all came out hot so I know it was not sitting under a heat lamp. I would return to this location.

"I don't stop eating when I'm full. The meal isn't over when I'm full. It's over when I hate myself." -Louis C.K. This should be printed on every menu here; I was about 2/3 through my Jack Daniels burger when I began to hate myself. It's beyond my scope of comprehension how any thing could be so greasy. Additionally, the $10 salad that my wife and I split for an appetizer was lower quality than Wendy's. There is literally no reason to eat here; you could go just about anywhere else that serves a comparably-priced burger, and there's a 99% chance that it will be better. I weep for those who don't realize that there better eating options out there.  That is all.
I wrote a bad review & then deleted it, was a little  harsh, TRUE, but harsh. No delete option on mobile.

A friend & I ventured here after an event at the Rosemont Convention Center.  My friend wanted to go to Hooters but I told him I didn't feel like watching middle aged men with wing sauce on their shirts & no teeth try to flirt with the waitresses.  So we decided to come here.   In terms of service this was probably the best T.G.I. Fridays I have been to.  As soon as you walk in a manager & hostess greets you & the manager thanked us for stopping by.   We sat down & they had plenty of t.v.'s in the bar area. We started off with an order of potato skins & wings.  The wings & potato skins came out within ten minutes.  The wings were really good & even though the potato skins were a little dry they were still pretty tastey.   After the appetizers I had to use the washroom to make sure I didn't have sauce all over me like a slob.  Instead of just telling me where the washroom was the manager showed me.  That is how good service should be.   For our main course we had the Jack Daniels burger.  The burgers were awesome.  They were juicy & full of flavor.  One of the best burgers I have had in a while.   Overall the staff was friendly, the restaurant was clean, the service was great & the food was really good.  I would eat here again if I was in the area.

Been here a few times. Overall not bad. Foods good. Some servers, especially the males, need to pay attention to everyone not just the pretty girls. Haven't been back in a while since one server barely made eye contact with me since he was staring at my girlfriend the whole time. He would come by and ask my girlfriend if she needed anything but leave me hanging. At one point I had her get me a soda since he wasn't serving me. Made sure to point this out to him for a tip.

If I can give this place zero stars or less I would! My group along with groups before mine were told it would be a 20-30 minute wait. I even called ahead to put my name on the list. The hostess had no clue what she was doing and the manager, well we'll just say she was clueless! We waited for over an hour!! They finally tried to seat us all after threatening to leave. The other groups stayed but I wasn't having it. I left and went to Houlihan's for much better food and service! Sad when management all the way down to the hostess were all overwhelmed and out of their element!

We were seated by the host, the waitress never came to our table. I had to ask another waitress to send someone over, the waitress comented to her she didn't want to come over to us! What the heck is that? Food was cold and service was horrible, just a terrible experience. Management not to be seen either!

"When you're here, it's Friday!" I've been here so many times since they first opened. The staff at this location is generally pretty friendly, I can only name a couple instances where we had staff that wasn't. The menu is constantly changing, but my experiences have been pretty consistent. I've never had under-/over-cooked food. The drinks are pretty inexpensive but still good. I usually get their Ultimate Long Island Iced Tea and follow it up with a Mudslide Martini for dessert! Their cheaper drink "specials" are just the watered down mixes, but you get what you pay for. I usually try and sit in the bar area, which gets particularly busy and loud during sporting events, like Hawks games and what not.  Overall, it's a decent, consistent meal for cheap.

Another chain restaurant and this one was full of sports fans watching the Sea Hawks trounce the S. F. 49'ers! Service was so, so, and seating stunk (I was right next to the kitchen). I'm sure I won't be back!

Worst place to ever work for. My husband of 6 years passed away two days ago from a drug overdose n i was the one to find his body. It was my second day at TGI Fridays n i called off the day after he died. When I came into work the next day, I was told if I missed anymore days I would be fired. Today my father in law and I were busy planning flower arrangements for the service. Called my manager, said I would be late and explained the situation. They were fine with it. I walk into work today n was automatically fired for being late even tho I called 25 mins ahead of time to explain the situation. So for anyone looking for a job, I would definitely recommend not being employed by them

Food was pretty good; had the barbeque boneless wings. The things I was most impressed with was our server Rhonda. My mom is elderly and very easily confused. Rhonda was so patient and helpful. It made a potentally awkward situation into a nice experience.

This has been a fun restaurant for me in the past but not this location. The waitress wasn't trained to help the customers. The table next to us complained about not getting silverware. My son didn't get his drink until he was almost finished with his meal. We ordered appetizers, got them - they were great - finished them and waited to order our meals. When we got them, my sandwich was cold and so were our fries. The waitress never offered me anything to drink nor did she come back to the table to ask my son if he needed a refill. I get that, if you're new, you have to learn but someone should be with you to train you while making sure that the customer doesn't suffer during your training period.
It's Friday's I don't have tell about the food, decor,etc. This location,nice staff and lively bar crowd. Not bad.

Every time I come here there are new issues.  If it isn't the food, it's the staff. If it's not the staff it's the regular males that eat here. This place just makes me sick and you better believe I've given them enough chances to know that I don't intend to come back. Word of advice, spend a little more and go to Chili's down the street.

I am livid. A good friend and I went to TGI Friday's in Rosemont on Thursday evening 08/20/2015, around 7:00pm. We wanted to try the endless apps. The server we had was dry and lacked a personality, for starters. I couldn't believe that because I have usually had very lively staff take care of me when I have dined there. Anyway, after we told the server that we wanted the endless apps with choices, she told us that we had to order our own, that there was not sharing. This struck us as odd because I though the whole purpose of appetizers was to "share" but okay, we get it, so we ordered our own and shared that way. Well, basically, we sampled plenty and we wanted to take home the rest that we had not eaten. I thought it was kind of odd that no to-go boxes were offered when we paid the bill. My friend asked for boxes and she snidely remarked that there are no "take homes". To our shock and amazement, she proceeds to grab the little centerpiece off the table to show us the tiniest print all the way at the bottom that says leftover apps cannot be taken home. First of all, my friend and I both have to wear reading glasses as it it, and if if you have been to Friday's, it is dim in there. I couldn't read the small fine print at the bottom of this card even with my reading glasses on! And who the hell would???? So, I asked to speak with the manager. This guy walks over and with a big-ass grin on his face he wants to know what the problem is, so we tell him that we would like to take our leftover appetizers home. He says, "I do apologize, there are no take homes." I said, "So, this food is going to be thrown away?" He says in the most kiss-my-ass way with a big grin on his face, "Yes." I reply with, "You mean to tell me that this food is going to be thrown away and wasted and you say that with a smile?" He replied again, "I do apologize, there are no take homes." Well, I do apologize for the bad review of your terrible server and yourself with your condescending, arrogant self that I am going to leave all over the web, corporate and on as many sites as I can possibly get my hands on. I do apologize that your server did not earn her tip when she could have allowed the take home and even if she couldn't, it was within your own power to allow this, Mr. Manager. You see, I use to be a restaurant server for many years and I know how difficult a job it is, so I tip very well. And I do not mean a measly little $5 bucks. See, I believe that your server should have made it clear, upon ordering the "endless apps" that there are no "take homes" and then we would have finished all apps that were delivered to us and not left any to be wasted and thrown away. It would seem to me that she was being passive-aggressive and thought, "I'll show them" and waited to drop that little tidbit as if she knew it was coming. That was ignorant and it was extremely wasteful!!! It was appalling and extremely disgraceful. The manager's attitude, to boot, really left one of the worst impressions of Friday's that I have ever experienced. WOW! So far, the word has been traveling far with family and friends. They agree, the "no take homes" should have been disclosed upon ordering. Nobody reads that small print crap! Just because it was located on the ad centerpiece does not make what happened right. I am complaining to the highest level and will not visit a Friday's again unless something is done to rectify the situation.

The bartenders are nice, the food is good but it gets boring after a while. I would definitely recommend it as a casual hang out with friends but only if you sit at the bar because the waiters there don't necessarily need to have experience to find employment (nor do they understand guest satisfaction).

I am at this location very often and after this past experience I refuse to go back! We went on a weekday around 8pm, way after dinner time. When we walked in the guy who was seating everyone stared at us and proceeded to sit someone else. Then he informed us it was a 30 minute wait! What angered me was half the resturant was EMPTY!!!!!! He said they only had a few servers and did not want to ruin anyones experience while eating. Im sorry that you cant realize maybe you should call someone in to work or that you are ruining the customer experience by making stuff up. Customer serice is not hard!

I have been to this TGI Friday's many times before and have always enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere until last night. My boyfriend and I arrived at about 8. We were seated at a table in the bar section and our server (I don't remember his name, but he was the only Caucasian male waiter there) came over and asked us if we wanted to get anything started. I asked for a glass of water with lemon and he bluntly responds with "No" and looks over to my boyfriend to see what he wants. I understand it was a joke, but I found it rude and I asked him "What?" and I guess he understood I was serious and left the table to go get the water. When he came back to give me my drink, I placed an order for the AYCE spicy chicken tostadas. At $10, that's a steal and they taste AMAZING! The first plate came out fast, and when I finished, the waiter asked if I wanted another and I said yes, but after the second plate, I didn't get to ask for another plate until I had to flag him down 30 minutes later. After I finished the third plate, I was ready to leave it because it was getting late and I was getting fed up with watching this waiter pass us back and forth, but never stopping to ask if we wanted more water or another plate. My bf and I were sitting there for so long that he just decided to go up to the register to pay so we can leave, but the person at the register said you have to wait for your waiter to give you the check. There were literally 5 different groups of people that came after us and left before us by the time we had eaten and asked for the check because this waiter had us on the pay-no-mind list. When he finally strolled over to us with the check, even getting our change took another 10 minutes. At this point I had already left the restaurant and my bf was in there waiting for the change. He had to literally go up to him because he was so busy laughing it up with a different table to get his change. We have never in our lives left a restaurant without tipping, but that nights service by this man was extremely shoddy. 2 stars because the food was excellent and I would have eaten more, but I'm sure it would've taken an extra hour to flag him down AGAIN. Next time I want TGI Friday's, I'm driving the extra mile to go to a different location.

This place needs to get their hours updated on Yelp. We came here around 12:05 am after a busted connection at O'Hare because Yelp said it was open till 1:00 am, only to find the manager saying the kitchen closes at 12:00 am. What a waste of time on a snowy night!

04/25/2014  This is the filthiest TGIF we've ever been to. We gave it a second chance, second time was actually a worse experience than the first. The menu was so sticky, and had food residue on them. We waited so long for our food. The people that sat down after us received, and finished their food before us. You would think they would take off an entree of our bill, the manager apologized and bought 1 dessert for 4 of us.

The service here is always great.  The hosts and hostesses open the door to greet you and say goodbye.  The manager always stops by at least once to check and make sure your meal is ok.  He stopped twice last night.   The potato skins are irregular at this location for some reason, including last night.  I wish they would perfect them here because I love their potato skins.  The korean steak tacos and Jack Daniels Whiskey Cake made up for it though.  Both were absolutely amazing so I hope they are never taken off the menu. Their beverages are always good too.  In honor of Mardi Gras, our server suggested an Asita Beer called Purple Haze.  Delicious and hope to try it again very soon.  Their Blackberry Long Island is yummy too.

TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!! I work for a multi billion dollar food distribution company who's headquarters are in Rosemont. We came after work for a happy hour. The waitress/bartender was so rude and slow. She kept pressuring us to order food when we only wanted drinks. I asked for extra lemons for my drink and she never brought them to me. When I asked another waitress she told our original waitress who slammed down some more lemons on the table and said "i forgot" in a nasty voice. I just looked over and she was scratching her head then eating out of a container of chips used for customers! Unbelievable and so unsanitary!! There are only 4 other customers here and she can't even service us? We are never coming here again. DISGUSTING.

NEVER have I experienced a visit as I did today at a TGIF restaurant! Too bad I can't rate it with zero stars, because the Rosemont location on Higgins Road DEFINITELY deserves it! My family stopped here today around 4 pm to have a post-graduation early dinner (the ceremony was held at the Rosemont Theater). We had a party of nine that included a disabled grandmother, a special-needs child and a two-year-old.  We arrived and were told by the host (a male with no name tag - I looked) that no one would be available to serve our party for 30 minutes, because the servers had worked ALL day, and would't return until then. REALLY????  Sooo, my family will be inconvenienced because everyone was on break??  He suggested that we have dinner in the bar if we didn't want to wait. The table he suggested was a ten-seat with high-top chairs that were 3 ft off the ground! I looked around the host station and saw that SEVERAL tables were empty!  There had to be less than 40 cars in the lot and the place WAS NOT BUSY. I mentioned this fact and also that kids have no place being in the bar, but was told that this was our only option - WOW!!!!!   Since everyone was hungry as the graduation ceremony took 3+ hrs, my family proceeded to the bar and we had to LITERALLY pick grandma up to get her on that chair!! What would have happened if she'd fallen off?? I'm sure she would have broken a hip, but did they care? - NO!!  With all those tables available, why couldn't the server in the bar come to our TABLE that would have been possibly no more than 50 feet away from where they sat us? No excuse for this action!!  We had to box our two-year-old between his parents to make sure HE didn't fall off the seat!  REALLY, TGIF??  Our special needs child nearly toppled the chair and I had to catch her!! There is ABSOLUTELY NO excuse your company can give me to make me see this differently!!  Maybe if we had pushed grandma into your restaurant in her wheelchair (trust me, she has one but she tried to manage on her cane, so we left it in the car not knowing what we were about to encounter), there would there have been a different reaction?  Probably not, because the majority of your servers were ALL ON BREAK! The food was typical/marginal, our server did her job (and was tipped accordingly) but I can't get past the way we were ushered into your establishment and the indifference that was shown to my family members that needed special accommodations - or at least, NORMAL CHAIRS!!  I've owned three restaurants and have worked as a server in my lifetime, and what I do know is that a GOOD BUSINESS ACCOMMODATES IT'S CUSTOMERS, AND NOT PRIORITIZES/SATISFIES THEIR OWN NEEDS AT THE EXPENSE OF THEIR CUSTOMERS AND THEIR SAFETY!! Shame on you!!!

3 ppl late lunch 3:00pm Friday afternoon. Waited 5 minutes to be greeted at the door, employees standing around talking, nice! Server was disinterested and disappeared frequently, we had to ask a passerby to take our order. Hostess stopped by often to make sure we were ok! Food quality has gone down significantly over the years, they used to make there own Chicken Fingers and hand roll them, well those days are over, look, feel and taste frozen store bought.  Potato Skins used to have tons of flavor, seems lacking and less ingredients, the sour cream ramekin has been reduced so you need to order additional sour cream. French fries we excellent could not stop eating them. TGIF used to be the industry leader, what happened?

When will people realize when you work in these customer service industry you should actually be nice and friendly especially if you work off of tips. The customer service could be a lot better and the staff could be more friendly as well. The bartender sucks keep it basic(shots)!!!!!!

No tables were bused, bartenders were doing shots, waitstaff were all playing around and being loud with each other, took forever to take our order, never asked if we wanted more drinks, was out of steak for the dish we ordered, never asked again how we were doing, place was very dirty, we both felt sick after eating here.  Will be leaving comments on TGI Fridays Guest Relations, UrbanSpoon, etc next and also contacting local Health Dept. This has been the worst visit in a restaurant in my entire life.  Did not want to tip them a penny but my date tipped them maybe .75.  Happy Birthday to me!  I am no so sure I will step in to another TGI Fridays again in my life!!

Had an early lunch here today and as a veteran, TGI Friday's generously provided me with a wonderful meal. It has been quite a while since I have eaten here since it is a little off my beaten path, however, I saw so many things on the menu that I want to try. Everything looked so good. I will be back soon. My meal consisted of a petite sirloin, parmesan steak fries and a small salad. The sirloin and steak fries were both so delicious. My server, Bryan, was very friendly, patient and helpful as I tried to decide what I wanted. Could not have asked for better service. Thank you, Bryan, and thank you TGI Friday's for helping make my day special.

We just came here and they said they couldn't seat 13 ppl together. It's 4pm on a Sunday and the place was empty. They said they were in between shift change so we can only sit separately. They just lost a whole bunch of $$ as 13 ppl walked out of my empty restaurant.
Food dreadful and service not so great we used to love that place not anymore.last time french onion soup was so dark almost black , salty and totally too thick.
Unlimited Mozzarella Sticks Lol. Cant have too many or you will become sick. The apps were good. Didn't have enough money for the entrees lol. But yeah kind of pricey but good food.
This server was slow as shit very rude as well to. She couldn't handle multi tasking. As far as the food iv had better fuck this place..
This location was pretty nice. The staff was friendly. The food was great and served promptly. This isnt a huge fridays, but still a nice spot to go to.

I've been to this fridays and other fridays many times and never have a bad experience. I love their rewards program! I ordered the chicken parm and it was delicious. I also got the mango lemonade drink and it is my favorite from there! The only thing I would like is more salsa with my chips :) Ask for Chris if your sitting by the bar, he's super nice!

Came here for dinner with a friend. I ordered Korean Steak Tacos, minutes after ordering the server informed me that they were "out of those." Now if this place serves various steak dinners... how can you be out of steak tacos, unless of course they come in frozen packages lol. So that bothered me quite a bit, actually, which makes me unlikely to come back to ANY TGI Fridays and not just this location. I ordered the Jack Daniels Chicken, delicious. As sides I got sweet potato fries (good) and broccoli, which came as gigantic stalks that were undercooked and hard to eat. Service wasn't great, wasn't bad. More likely to try somewhere else instead of coming here again.

So happy to find out I am now living next to a TGIF ...  Food was great we had 2 servers one was a young guy and he was so speedy and fast it came across a bit rude and there was a girl who brought our food. It was the first time anyone ever asked my husband to cut his steak to see if it was just how he liked it. It usually is not WD enough so this impressed us. The rest of our food tasted great and we enjoyed the atmosphere.  We will be going back here often.  Update************  The reviews about bad service here are true. I was so upset my last time here I wanted to call there corprate office. We showed up 10 minutes before the restaurant side stops taking orders. I asked what time they stop taking orders and she told me in 10 minutes but that they still would not seat us, we would need to sit at the bar and order from the bar menu.  The bar was packed .  Several other occasions the servers have been on the rude side.  As exited as I was with my previous review I will not be returning to this TGIF.

I haven't been to a Fridays in years so as we were passing by in an unfamiliar area we said why not. Ordered a cocktail off the specials menu, probably my fault for not realizing how sweet it would be. It was pretty undrinkable, it was just way too sweet. Food was your basic flavorless chain restaurant bar food that doesn't have any effort put into it. Service wasn't fantastic but I guess to be fair it's really cool looking inside.

Maintaining the 2-star status after our last visit.  Our service was better this time around. Wait time for a server (and water) after being seated was cut in half, and the food made it to our table a bit quicker. Too bad the food itself fell short of its more respectable service time. Very inconsistent. One of our orders was wrong (out of five), and a majority of MY food was borderline cold. The only thing keeping my dish warm (obviously the white rice and steamed broccoli had been plated well in advance) was the grilled chicken atop the "Dragonfire" medley.  No joke, the temperatures on the plate varied from cold to warm, and when ordering something "steamed" and/or "cooked" you expect it served at a hot "cooked" temperature. RIGHT? To receive it colder than the dish itself is unappetizing and disappointing. Not to mention again the lack of anything resembling seasoning. I really think the cooks here are scared, or maybe advised by management to stay inside some bland, tasteless recipe box. That, or these cooks taste buds have disappeared. Whatever. I went in with low expectations, and came out again, with low expectations.

Very impressed with their new gluten free menu. Most places state dip no chips, burger no bun, but they changed things! The turkey burger and hamburger are great! And the gluten free buns are even better than regular buns! Wish they would get separate fryer for sweet potato fries tho!
Please do not eat here if time is of the essences. this place sucks, wait staff are unable to get anything right they double charge bring the wrong order and just suck at customer service.

The Reuben sandwiches here are an abomination. They are the worst I have ever had anywhere. I was initially surprised to see three slices of bread (not even rye), but that was only the begining of the worst. They actually used grilled onions instead of sauerkraut on the sandwich. That may of been tolerable, but there was only about 2 slices of thin cut meat between each of the slices, they put horse radish sause on it, and they give you a tiny side of some awfull tasting thousand island dressing. Overall it was horible!

I just came from this location tonight. This was the first time we had been to Fridays in years and my boyfriend and I each ordered one drink as well as an appetizer and entree off the 474 menu. The food and drinks were great, however, our bill came out to 47 dollars and some change. We asked the server Ashley to split the bill and she ended up splitting it incorrectly and giving my boyfriend 2 more dollars on his, but we just decided to sign and pay because we were ready to go. Once we got into the car, we realized that not only had she split the bill incorrectly but ended up charging us another 3 extra dollars from our original bill. I called the restaurant and spoke to the manager and explained our situation and told him I wasn't going to go back for 3 dollars, but I wanted to bring it to his attention. He said he would take care of it and figure out what happened. I don't know if it was a computer error or the server, but if I do ever go back to Fridays it probably won't be this location.

I emailed corporate about this restaurant last month regarding a horrible dining experience I encountered. (The food was completely burnt, waitress was rude and disappeared at times). The manager contacted me 2 days later and offered a gift certificate because of the numerous problems that occurred during dinner. Well,  A month later still no gift certificate! And this is how you run a business?

When they just opened, service was phenomenal!  Now, it has gone down the drain. We came for lunch at 11:30am hoping to beat the lunch crowd.  Got seated right away, waiter gave us the menu right away, and we ordered.  Then, we waited....and waited....and waited for our food.  We were hoping to be in & out of there in 1 hour.  It turned into 1 hr & 30 minutes. Never again.

went here while I was in the area for a Con. the food was OK our server was like a 2 out of 5 she really just seemed like we were another tip, no character and didn't really check on us that much. food was decent, its what you expect from TGI and the price wasn't  horrible.

Yuck! Talk about gross, by this I mean the sliminess of this location. It was one of the dirtiest restaurants I have ever had the misfortune of coming across! The food was descent the first time I went and since has rolled steadily down hill to this point where I have decided never to visit this place again! The waitress we had was very sweet but the hostess was a moron because in the whole empty place first she sat us next to the door which was freezing and we had our newborn baby with us so when I asked to sit somewhere else she put us next to the bathroom so trust me I would have rather been cold at that point! I wondered why until I looked around and saw that almost all the tables were dirty and covered with dishes the entire time we were there! The food was eh. The bill was high!

Eh so so. I will say I had the blue cheese burger and it wasn't to bad. Although this place on a Friday night is loud and being seated by the kitchen is double the noise. Its TGI Friday's nothing special The prices are just to high for the quality of food you get. I notice most places are cutting back in quality because of the economy so really who is to blame. Our server was great she was quick and very friendly. all in all its ok I don't come here that often, i believe i was here maybe twice in 2012 and once this year because we got some gift cards for Christmas. If i had to spend my own money I would go elsewhere.

Meh!  They totally change the menu on me, boooo!!! I actually went cause i saw the add on the tv that they added jack daniels entrees to their 2 for 10 menu so i went. There was not jack daniels on the menu they just put a sticker on top of the menu with 4 options of food. First of all i hate false advertisment second the food was way overcooked no bueno :(. I wont be going to this TGIF maybe i give other locations a try.

The food was decent! Nothing spectacular by any means. I'm not usually into chains but wanted a nice place to grab some semi-healthy food that was near my hotel. They ended up messing up my order twice but the bartender quickly fixed the kitchens mistake. Over all it was ok.

I've been to this location twice over the last few months. The first time was right before the Britney concert (yeah, yeah -quit giving me flack!) Every other place in town was packed -but not here. It was busy -a "healthy" kind of crowded -but no wait. We were able to get a good meal and a few drinks to properly lube up for the upcoming Circus (like-like-like a circus! oops, sorry...I did it again! Ha!) Anyway, I went here recently for lunch too and the food was really good. It's a nice lunchtime or hang-out-after-work place if you are looking for affordable food and drink. I like this location -never too crazy crowded and the servers are very friendly!

For the most part the service is great.  There is one waitress that is totally awesome named Frannie.  If she's working ask to be seated in her section.  She won't treat you wrong. The food has always been good.  When the kitchen has screwed up our order, they always fix it with no questions. Trivia night is a blast on Wednesdays. Only bad experience was one night I had a REALLY bad day at work and wanted to let go and get drunk.  My husband was the DD, so I ordered a pitcher of margaritas.  I drank the whole pitcher myself and wasn't even buzzed.  :(  I don't think they put an ounce of tequila in there.  The service that night was also horrible.  Didn't go back for several months.
Terrible service and management is a joke. Our check got lost and we had to pay twice. A JOKE! Never again.
Great service!  My glass of ice tea was never lower than half full.    Had Ribeye and lobster.  Ribyeye was a bit "fatty" but good flavor.  Everything nice and clean; even the restroom!

Food was ok...This one waitress named Jennifer was incredibly rude, took 20 mins to bring out our water and take our order...oh she also charged me for a drink i never received and tried to lie to the manager to cover her ass....I will NEVER go back to this TGI Fridays! I will continue going to the one on Erie st instead

tgif you have been our fav spot for quite a few years now but ever since you guys changed your entire staff and management i've noticed that things have changed as well. the consistency in the food is not there.  i ordered a medium rare burger and it came out well done. i'm a sous chef in a high volume restaurant and consistency is what i preach about every day. i'd think again for going here for a burger specially when there are more options now just a few minutes away from this location

I go to this location all the time! It's very new, but the staff seems to be the most friendliest here than at the other locations i have gone to (Schaumburg, Hoffman, Oak Park). The place is very clean, and seems to always be busy, but they rarely go on a wait.  The Manager's are always happy to help you out with any problem. My 3rd visit, i ordered a steak medium, but it came out well done.  Without hesitating my server sent it back, gave me a free soup while i waited, and the Manager came out, apologized, gave me my steak back (cooked perfectly) and also a gift card that we could use on our next visit. I highly recommend this place!
Great place to go. I went to have dinner there with a lady that I was seeing and everything turned out great, the food and the atmosphere were amazing. Great place to go to talk.

We went back and they managed to not screw up anything, although they didn't exactly impress us, either. I'll give them one more star for now, since they apparently have mastered the fine art of giving people the menu item they actually ordered. I don't know if the management climbed up some mountain in Tibet and spoke to a wise man to do this, or if they just pulled their heads out of their butts for ten minutes. Either way, things are improving...a little.
I always sit by the bar, and the waiters and waitress are always quick and polite. Never had a problem. Great Selection of food as well.
Bad service! Salty food! That's it in a nut shell -to bad the Ram was loaded-

Maybe we got lucky because our family dining experience on a friday night @ 8pm was great! We were at the TGI location downtown 6 months ago and it was awful. We got a gift certificate for TGI plus i'm a stripes member and got an email discount of 20% off our meal - so we decided to go. We got seated right away and our server was a kind young man. Kids ordered chicken nuggets and a cheeseburger and I had the dragonfire salmon. Kids enjoyed their meal. My salmon was a a very generous portion! i was so surprised! Foo foo places give you a 1/4 of the size. I was hesitant of the spiciness so server suggested putting the Kun Pao sauce on the size - what a genius! It had mandarin oranges, pico de gallo and this awesome slaw! Someone complained about the large broccoli stalk in a previous review, but i thought it was delish! Not too soft where it would fall apart when pierced with a fork. Hard enough to slice it into smaller pieces. I asked for a cup of melted butter and i was in heaven. We are definitely coming back.
Good lunch spot although service can be a little slow; decent food ptions but most food tends to be on the greasy side. Why does everything have to have bacon on it???

I ate here about a year ago, the food sucked everything way too salty. I told myself never again. Well fast forward to present day, to my horror  I received a gc to this place for christmas! Unlike alot of other chain restaurants you can only use a TGIF gc at TGIF. So here we are on a cold sat night not having a real plan for dinner. I say to the hubby lets go to TGIF, neither one of us was overly thrilled with this idea, but he had no plan. We did get seated right away but thats where our luck ran out. The waiter was definitely not seasoned. Not rude just slow. Too much waiting for drink and app order. I am convinced it would not matter what we ordered, again with the overdose of salt. The chicken finger app was kind of hard and too salty. I ordered some sort of Jack Daniels glazed salmon. It was just ok. The food was lukewarm at best. My hubby ordered a cajun pasta dish, he liked his. Good for him. Then when we went to pay we gave the waiter the gc with our credit card so of course he didn't apply the gc to the total. We had to flag him down to fix it. If I didn't have that damn gc I would never have come back here. So the moral of the story is if you like very salty food and mediocre service come here, if not save your money eat somewhere else.

Short and sweet: Really poor service. We sat at a table in the bar area. When we first arrived, around 4:30pm on a Friday, no waitress was on duty yet so the bartender was our server. That might make sense when the place is empty, but as the night went on, not so much.  When the waitress did come on, she stopped to inform us the bartender would continue to be our 'server' - even though there was a shift change and it wasn't even the same guy. Needless to say, the bartender was not our 'server.' Stands to reason that he have his hands full working behind the bar, right?  The result was that we had to keep getting up from our table to go to the bar to order another beer, or get more napkins or whatever. It was all the more annoying when the waitress was right there taking orders from the tables on either side of us! So we would go up to the bar to order another round and instead of just giving us the beer, he would insist he would bring it our table. Umm...okay...even though I am standing right there. So now he would have to come out from behind the bar, to carry 2 beers to our table, leaving no one behind the bar. I'm sure during this time, there were customers sitting at the bar wondering 'Where is the bartender?'  It was just very strange. I also used the rest room before I left. One sink was clogged and had standing water in it, one towel dispenser was empty. The only good thing about this experience was that it gave us a whole new appreciation for the waitstaff at our other venues.

I went here two or three times when it first opened but was not impressed.  The main dishes were surprisingly greasy, the fries were soggy, etc.  I may give it another shot to see if they've improved any.
